Hi Nils277,

Suggestion times two and a question at the end!

A vehicle bay may be a good option, maybe twice as wide and a little taller that he service bay? My first thought for the service bay was not actually for storing items, but as a garage for rovers. However, a science jr doesn't quite fit, let alone putting it on wheels to drive it in.

As an extension to this I might be cheeky enough to ask for top opening one for vtol drones! This might be a step too far however, and a mk2 cargo bay (if you do base to mk2 adapters) would suffice okay. 

If this isn't on the cards then I am happy to scarper my own suggestion by noting that future forays onto other heavenly bodies it is possible/probable that even the EVA suits are themselves never brought inside a pressurised habitat and will remain sealed on the external hull of a base. Yet for sheltering vehicles from storms on worlds with atmosphere it might not be such a bad idea!

The question is how the Kerman & Kerman Orbit and Surface Structures promotional photo was taken. The EVA tuxedo (without helmet) doesn't have the distinctive neck for attaching a helmet.

You have a great response time and I'm looking forward to your update soon. Congratulations as I post for CurseForge and KerbalStuff downloads totalling 4,600 so far!

Peace.
Lol, i suggested a rover garage too, but its been pretty long since

A garage is not really needed. If it fits the undeployed footprint, it's just not big enough to be useful. Deployed doesn't help part count, because the rover is still there, just invisible. Really for a "garage," we should be advocating for KIS to include the ability to store craft files. Then a garage has a volume, the craft has a volume, and when you park it, then close the door, the parts disappear (saving part count). *That* would be useful.

Thanks tater and Frizzon. That would be useful to remove parts to reduce part count. I was thinking of small rovers, that could go out for Science^TM^ with only the basic supplies or collect visitors. Larger rovers would end up being a similar same size as the base and therefore would weather any storm just as happily as the base.

A garage would need to be just something a bit larger. Unfortunatly without tweakscale you can't design smaller than the size of your largest part. If KIS was enabled for craft files or Nils277 was able to integrate the Hanger Mod, for a workable rover for collecting said Science^TM^ then a larger garage would still be needed.

Peace.

Changelog:

v0.1.4

New Parts:

- [\*=1]Added the Planetary ISRU  
[\*=1]Added the "Bigfoot" Landing Legs  
[\*=1]Added Base to MK2 adapter  
[\*=1]Added Base to Size1 adapter  
[\*=1]Added Xenon Container  
[\*=1]Added Stack-Separator for the Base-Profile  
[\*=1]Added Bi-Cupler for two Bases to Size2  
[\*=1]Added Heat-Shield with the Base Profile

Enhancements:

- [\*=1]Scaled down the chairs in the IVA of Habitat MK2 so one can see the Kerbals face  
[\*=1]Changed crew capaity of Habitat MK1 from 2 to 3  
[\*=1]The Base parts can now also be found in a new profile category and in two new Manufaturer categories  
[\*=1]Added new main filter for this mod with functions as subcategory

Bug fixes:

- [\*=1]Habitat MK1 is now in the right science category  
[\*=1]Several Typos and errors in the descriptions removed. Thanks to Wolf Baginski for pointing them out!  
[\*=1]Scaled and mirrored some flags on the parts to be correct.

Also updated the screenshots in the main post ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Regarding the sorting of the Parts in the editor. They are still placed in the category they belong to. Putting them all in one Category was a bit confusing. But because the Poll showed that many want to have the parts in one place i added a complete new filter for only parts from this mod.

I also wanted to implement a part that is a combination of a rover-wheel and a landing-leg. But this would take a bit more time to complete.
